summary:
As a Senior Validation Consultant at Lonza, I am the SPOC for the validation of systems in the "Joy" project, ensuring compliance with GAMP 5, 21 CFR Part 11, and ALCOA+ principles. I also have a concurrent role as a Lead CoE CSV at Agidens, where I manage a team of seven CSV engineers and consultants, and provide advice, coaching, and training in support of computer system validation, data integrity, and compliance projects.

With over 15 years of experience in the pharma industry, I have a strong proficiency in business system analysis, quality management systems, and risk assessments for various manufacturing and clinical applications. I have a Lean/Six Sigma green belt certification, and I have successfully conducted QA and peer reviews of project deliverables, as well as supported internal and external audits. I am passionate about delivering high-quality and reliable solutions that meet the needs and expectations of my clients and stakeholders.

awards.title: Best film Mottofestival
awards.description:
Our film "Achterbaks" won 1st prize during the Mottofestival Inschattingsfout, held on Nov 22 2012 in Tilburg and the prize for the best feature film and a NOMINATION for NOVA festival
Spelers/players:
Bertie Immick: moordenaar/murderer
Thea van de Loo: slachtoffer/victim
Robert van Vlijmen: drugsdealer
Theo Poort: drugsdealer
Dannis Steenvoorden: chauffeur/driver
Florence Haring: lijk/body
Wij bedanken voor de medewerking/we thank the following for their cooperation:
Politie Brabant, afdeling Oss
Shell Hanex de Ruwaard
Garage J.van den Heuvel, Oijen
Shot on location in Oss, the Netherlands.
Filmcrew:
Emile van Zeeland
Jeroen Haring
Wim de Bruijn
Emily Koppenrade
Henri Schuurmans
Filmed under auspices of Nova & Union Internationale du Cinéma (UNICA)

projects.title: SAPIII project
projects.description:
New SAP III Facility Building Project  

General IT and Automation (I&A) architectural design, including:
o	Network and Server/PLC design, serving SAP III process equipment and information systems as well as EMS field automation by extension of existing Shop Floor Network (SFN) and optionally creating an Ethernet system bus network for interlinking equipment and/or utility PLC’s for direct mutual signal exchange;
o	Relation/reusing/integration with existing central IT facilities (SFN, WIFI, OsiSoft PI, BAS/EMS servers, etc.);
o	Positioning required system functionalities within I&A architecture.
For the connections into the existing BAS/EMS and Shop floor networks it is assumed that two additional core switches per network will be required, actual requirements are to be defined in the BOD.

o	Expansion of the existing site Building Automation System (BAS) to the new SAP III building to serve the field instrument controlling and alarming for HVAC and utilities (non-GxP).
o	Expansion of the existing site Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) to include the new SAP III Facility Building Critical process parameters of the LDS. Configuration of SAP III signals is in scope of the project.
	EMS including EMS SCADA programming and OsiSoft PI data acquisition and reporting

Development, installation, commissioning and qualification for the automation systems in the SAP III Building, including the following 
o	Main production process equipment including:
	Autoclave
•	Process systems and equipment will be controlled by integral Process Control systems (PCS / PLC) and connected to SCADA (LDS and Autoclave)
•	The autoclave will have critical process parameters and these must be recorded by the site EMS system.
	Renderer/ Digester  (Thermal Tissue Digester (TTD))
	Decontamination system (EDS) (a.k.a. Kill tank)
•	Process systems and equipment will be controlled by integral Process Control systems (PCS / PLC) and connected to SCADA (LDS and Autoclave)

projects.title: SFFD factory
projects.description:
The Sterile Filling and Freeze-dry Department & CUB (Central Utilities Building) project will be executed on a new MSD site. 

The scope consists of the following:
•	Sterile Filling and Freeze-dry Department
•	Central Utilities Building 
•	PE site infrastructure.

	SFFD 
1	Siemens PCS 7
		COTS system with configurable items (recipe management )	
2	Siemens S7 PLCs 	
			Bulk line	
3			Specialty line 	
4*		Auxiliary Process Equipment dedicated control systems 	* 
4a				COP/SOP Station 	
4b				Sterilization and Destruction Autoclaves	
4c				Purified Water (PW) distribution 	
4d				WFI water distribution 	
4e				Liquid bio waste inactivation 	
4f				Blending isolator +glove testing	
4g				Blending monitoring units 	
4h				Clean Steam Generation	
	CUB 	
5	Operated by local control monitoring (in CUB)				
6	Shop floor network

projects.title: Oracle Clinical 4.6
projects.description:
Oracle Clinical or O*C is a database management system designed by Oracle to provide data management, data entry and data validation functionalities to Clinical Trials process.

The Major Functions Supported by Oracle Clinical are:

    Clinical Study Protocol Definition and Management
    Definition of Metadata collected during a Clinical Study.
    Creation of Data Entry System
    Creation of Data Management System to clean and reconcile Data
    Validation Procedures
    Data Loading and Extracting
    Thesaurus Management System for Coding Medical Terms
    Laboratory Reference Range Management System

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the optimization, performance and reliability of technical systems, analytical lab equipment and automated process installation.

-Purchase and implementation of new technical systems
-Coordinator of implementation projects within the USP production department.  
-Part of site-wide investment projects.
-Establish principles for new technical systems 
ensuring process, GMP, safety, and user requirements and compliance.
-Implementation with an executive role during commissioning, qualification and retirement, following the Computerized System Validation (CSV) principles.
-Improve/optimize technical systems under your management as a system owner
-Determine need for system optimizations, and develop a business case.
-Manage portfolio of ongoing improvement initiatives data integrity and implement actions in the department 
-Automated process installations and lab equipment. Focus on maintaining the operational functioning/reliability and the qualified GMP status of these systems. 

System management:
-POC technical malfunctions and action holder in search for a solution.
-Define necessary tasks to maintenance and data integrity during the life cycle of technical systems and monitor their implementation.
- Handle system-related technical deviations, apply root-cause analyzes and problem-solving techniques.
-Receive / guide external parties in maintenance activities.
-Represent the M&R department as system owner during audits / inspections.
-Periodic review systems under your management and decide whether this system is operationally reliable and inspection-ready. 
-Assessing maintenance performed, system deviations that have occurred, and compliance of the system and associated system documentation with respect to the applicable QMS.

-Expert CSV and data integrity (DI). 
-Central to improvement processes and new technical system implementations
-Ensure connections between M&R and other departments, within and outside the USP production department.

profile_positions.title: Senior Computer System Validation consultant

profile_positions.description:
Lead CoE CSV  at AGIDENS LIFE SCIENCES 

Managing a team of (7) CSV engineers /consultants and provides advice, coaching and training in support of Computer System Validation Data integrity and Compliance experts ​

Planning, performing, reporting across the CSV and Data integrity and Compliance Team ​

Coaching and managing the team of CSV experts across customer sites where the experts are on-site ​
Progamme  lead for Data Integrity Programme.​

Responsible for the development and implementation of the CSV strategy for the CSV group activities, covering all functions. ​

Key involvement in setting group standards on CSV, 21CRFPart11 & data integrity ​

Accountable to implement C&Q and CSV updated guidelines from relevant CoEs as well as guidance and practical related solutions.​

Responsible for providing leadership and coordination on CSV Data integrity and compliance activities leveraging with both internal and external resources. ​

Provides objective advice and strategy, structure, management and operations of an organization, in support of identified business purposes and objectives.​


Provides advice, assistance, and guidance in any area associated with the computer system validation & data integrity,  planning, procurement, provision, delivery, management, maintenance or effective use of information systems and their environments.​

Builds a relationship with stakeholders and clients: Provides advice, assistance and guidance in his/her area of specialization. Direct consultancy activities with customers/clients ​

-Manages projects through their planning, procurement, provision, delivery and maintenance cycle.​
-Customer Service Management. Ensures that high standards of customer service are provided, and maintained to the highest level possible​

Manages  customers’  IT  environments  and  supports  the validated state,  integrity  and  availability of all applications.​

volunteer_experiences.description: coordination a communication platform between the school and a select group of parents, This results in a good information exchange to improve the school environment. Topics discussed are whatever is relevant at that moment and can be: safety, health, communication, the school results of the students, activityies in and outside school.

Consultative body  to consult with each other, the school management and the staff.

-think along with the day-to-day management of the school's policy
-giving feedback to the parent representation in the Participation Council
-Advise the school (asked or unsolicited)
-Organize research among parents on certain topics (drugs, MSN, school course) to contribute to educational developments (eg teacher scarcity, internet and privacy)
-Stimulating activities that contribute to a good school climate such as sports and cultural events, study trips and school parties

A citizen council member is an appointed politician and is a regular member of the group with regard to activities.

A citizen council member is part of a municipal council faction but has not been elected to the municipal council.
He has a supporting task to the permanent councilors and has limited authority. A citizen council member may not participate in the deliberations and votes of the council.
A citizen councilor can only be appointed to the council committees on the recommendation of the group, must take the oath / vow regarding secrecy, and may participate in the deliberations of that committee.
Member of the urban and rural planning Committee

Een  burgerraadslid  is een benoemde politicus en maakt regulier deel uit van de fractie met betrekking tot werkzaamheden.

Een burgerraadslid maakt deel uit van een gemeenteraadsfractie maar is niet gekozen in de gemeenteraad. 
Hij heeft een ondersteunende taak naar de vaste raadsleden en heeft een beperkte bevoegdheid. Een burgerraadslid mag niet deelnemen aan de beraadslagingen en stemmingen van de raad. 
Een burgerraadslid kunnen alleen in de raadscommissies benoemd worden op voordracht van de fractie, dienen daartoe de eed/gelofte af te leggen betreffende geheimhouding, en mogen aan de -ook besloten- beraadslagingen van die commissie deelnemen. 
Benoeming 20 september 

Lid van de commissie ruimte

candidate city councilor for the 2022 municipal elections
kandidaat gemeenteraadslid voor de Gemeenteraadsverkiezingen 16 maart 2022 in Oss Lijst5 plaats 10
